intro: Kohleria hirsuta var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed hirsute kohleria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. Its unique appearance and compact growth make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
